text: Web Accessibility starts with a strong API http://t.co/RbMiyFUC /via @jonathanstark
If you are interested, my @fronteersconf talk is also available in the podcast http://t.co/FjOIVUyb
Thank you @bokardo for saying this. Design is not just 'making things pretty' http://t.co/RlDlNWw4
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"/> looks to be the smallest possible SVG document. cc @mathias
As @pornelski & @beverloo point out: if you simply want to display SVG, smallest code to do that:  <!doctype html><svg> http://t.co/4W4RfL9D
A nice list of mobile UI considerations by @estellevw http://t.co/yzeAnszo
Tweaking tests for XPath, querySelector, getElementsByTagName http://t.co/zZsUmkey XPath slowest in FF/Op.
XSS vulnerabilities with unusual character encodings. tl;dr; use utf-8 http://t.co/km8aDcFZ
A take on requestAnimationFrame shim by @erikjmoller http://t.co/RjyzZ473
http://t.co/YxSWfjqs - great post by @joshuabixby on the danger of a story which also underscores this awesome talk http://t.co/2IsK1Ne8
